brief_summary.textblock:
Analysis of stored seat-pressures in SCI patients during a 4-week use of an on-board device.
      During this period, patients write in an agenda noteworthy events that could occur while
      they're using their wheelchair. A control is done every week and the device can be changed
      until it is returned at the end of the study period.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preliminary Study Leading to Prevention of Pressure Ulcers by the Use of an On-board Device : Ergonomic Assessment of Wheelchair-seat Pressures in Spinal Cord Injured (SCI) Patients ( PRESDIE)

detailed_description.textblock:
-  inclusion visit : recovery of the signed  informed-consent form, clinical examination,
           skin control, seat-pressures control, device 9-position control, delivery of the agenda
           for noteworthy events

        -  3 follow-up visits : noteworthy events check, skin control, cushioncloth control,
           device 9-position control

        -  return visit : device return, agenda return, skin control, seat-pressures control

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria :

          -  Patient is male or female, aged ≥ 18

          -  Patient accepting the initial assessment and the following visits during the protocol

          -  Written informed consent has been obtained

          -  Patient having a social assurance

          -  Spinal cord injury  ≤ C6 stable Spinal cord trauma  > 1 an

          -  Main mode of ambulation : own manual wheelchair

        Exclusion criteria :

          -  Aged ≤ 18

          -  Adults under guardianship

          -  Patients do not speak French, refusing or unable to be followed

          -  Pregnant or lactating women

          -  Person deprived of their liberty by judicial or administrative decision

          -  Person hospitalised without consent

          -  Pelvic pressure ulcer ongoing

          -  Cognitive disorder incompatible with the use of the device, understanding and conduct
             of the study

clinical_study.keyword: Pressure ulcer, spinal cord injury, on-board device
clinical_study.official_title: Preliminary Study Leading to Prevention of Pressure Ulcers by the Use of an On-board Device : Ergonomic Assessment of Wheelchair-seat Pressures in Spinal Cord Injured (SCI) Patients

overall_official.affiliation: CHU de Nantes- Hôpital Saint Jacques

primary_outcome.description:
Intra- and inter-patients variability of stored pressures for the whole included population Measured at the end of the study
Each topic will be equipped with a layer of pressure sensors 32x32. The pressure maps are stored every second rule, which will be of the order of 30 000 maps daily. For each topic, we will be able to calculate the frequency and location of peak pressure
primary_outcome.measure: Intra- and inter-patients variability of stored pressures for the whole included population Intra- and inter-patients variability of stored pressures for the whole included population

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Intra- and inter-patients variability of stored pressures for subpopulations :
quadriplegic vs paraplegic
according to high-risk areas for pressure ulcers
according to noteworthy events
Each topic will be equipped with a layer of pressure sensors 32x32. The pressure maps are stored every second rule, which will be of the order of 30 000 maps daily. For each topic, we will be able to calculate the frequency and location of peak pressure Measured at the end of the study
secondary_outcome.measure: Intra- and inter-patients variability of stored pressures for subpopulations

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
